Spring A2010 status                  last update 11Apr19 by mph
Complete ALFALFA coverage will cover drifts from 1 to 148 in 2 passes.
Completed drifts
RA range here comes from daily logs. "Start" refers to start 
time of first of sequential drifts; "stop" means end of last drift
for that observing session. Gaps in data taking are not always recorded. 
THIS IS NOT INTENDED TO BE COMPLETE OR ACCURATE! CAVEAT EMPTOR!

         09.02.06 01p2  0723-1418 to finish that one.
Note 35: 09.02.18 dataflow gap 0719-1041 and 1049-1411
Note 36: 09.04.08 WAPP3 gap 1107-1249. Should be enough for cals on either side of that.
Note 37: 09.04.14 WAPP failures near beginning and end might not leave enough data for cals: observed 0903 to 0933 then had a gap; observed 0948 to 
                  1210 then had a gap (should be OK); observed 1212 to 1504 then had a gap (this period should be OK), after gap only 3 drifts (1506 
                  to 1537). Tonight's run therefore only truly covers 0948 to 1504.
Note 38: 09.12.15 Picked up extra night due to Xmitter failure. Lost 2 minutes due to restart necessitated by network glitch.
Note 39: 10.03.28 Lost time due to pointing issues/hitting ZA limit. Originially scheduled drift was too close to 
                  zenith.
Note 40: 10.04.19 Declination for drift83p1 wrong: 83p2 redone 0848-1622
Note 41: 10.04.27 Called 76p1. Although we set decl to +1822 18 for this drift, the telescope moved and tracked at +1814.
                  Since we had trouble getting to +1815 previously, we left it in place all night. Who knows why!?
Note 42: 10.05.01 Had to point at +18d19m00 to get it close; DecJ is a bit higher 18d22m35 on average. 
Note 43: 11.01.10 Observer noticed issue with quicklook; aborted and restarted just in case.
         11.03.14 Redone 1210-1321 1328-1530 WAPP gap (doesn't matter)
Note 44: 11.01.31 Lost first 1.5 hours due to incessant WAPP errors/warnings. Arun called. After restarting
                  several times, decided to continue with data taking since most are only warnings. Data look ok. Covered 1035-1216
